'Vincent Edward "Vin" Scully' (born November 29, 1927) is an American
sportscaster, best known as the play-by-play announcer for the Los Angeles
Dodgers baseball team. He has been with the team since its days in Brooklyn. His
64 seasons with the Dodgers (1950âpresent) is the longest tenure of any
broadcaster with a single team in professional sports history, and he is second
by one year to only Tommy Lasorda in terms of number of years with the Dodgers
organization in any capacity. Scully currently calls most Dodger home games (and
selected road games) on Prime Ticket, KCAL television, and KLAC radio. He is
known for his dulcet voice and signature introduction to Dodger games, "It's
time for Dodger Baseball."
